categories.name: Gym
categories.description: Guidance for strength and aesthetic competitions.

competitions.name: Powerlifting Meet
competitions.description: A plan focused on maximizing strength and recovery for meet day.

items.title: Final Carb Load
items.description: Focus on easily digestible carbs like pasta, rice, and potatoes. Aim for 7-10g of carbs per kg of bodyweight throughout the day.

items.title: Stay Hydrated
items.description: Drink plenty of water and electrolyte beverages. Avoid alcohol completely.

items.title: Active Recovery & Mobility
items.description: Go for a light walk and perform gentle mobility exercises. Do not stretch intensely.

items.title: Avoid Heavy Lifting
items.description: Do not perform any heavy squats, bench presses, or deadlifts. Your body must be fully recovered.

items.title: Final Meal
items.description: Eat a familiar, balanced meal of complex carbs (oatmeal) and lean protein (whey). Avoid high-fat and high-fiber foods.

items.title: Sip Fluids
items.description: Continue sipping on water. Do not chug large amounts.

items.title: General Warm-up
items.description: 5-10 minutes on a stationary bike or light jogging to increase blood flow.

items.title: Specific Warm-up
items.description: Start with an empty barbell for your first lift. Perform several sets, gradually increasing the weight towards your opening attempt. Keep reps low (1-3).

items.title: Focus and Visualize
items.description: Listen to music, stay calm, and visualize successfully completing your lifts.

categories.name: Sports
categories.description: Guidance for team and endurance-based sports.

competitions.name: Football Match
competitions.description: A plan to ensure you're energized and mobile for game day.

items.title: Top Up Glycogen Stores
items.description: Eat balanced meals with a focus on complex carbohydrates like brown rice and whole wheat pasta.

items.title: Consistent Hydration
items.description: Drink water consistently throughout the day to ensure you are fully hydrated for the match.

items.title: Light 'Walk-Through'
items.description: A very light session focusing on tactics or a short jog and dynamic stretches. Avoid intense sprints or drills.

items.title: Pre-Match Meal
items.description: Eat a meal high in carbohydrates, moderate in protein, and low in fat and fiber. Example: Grilled chicken with white rice.

items.title: Avoid New Foods
items.description: Do not try any new foods or supplements on match day to prevent potential stomach issues.

items.title: Dynamic Warm-up
items.description: Start with a light jog, followed by dynamic stretches like high knees, butt kicks, and leg swings.

items.title: Sport-Specific Drills
items.description: Progress to short sprints, agility drills (cone work), and passing/dribbling drills to prepare for game intensity.

categories.name: Endurance
categories.description: Guidance for long-distance events like running and cycling.

competitions.name: Marathon
competitions.description: A plan to optimize performance and nutrition for running 42.195km.

items.title: Serious Carb Load
items.description: Continue carbo-loading. Focus on familiar, easily digestible carbs like rice, pasta, and bread. Avoid excessive fiber.

items.title: Hyper-Hydration
items.description: Sip water and electrolyte drinks all day. Aim for pale straw-colored urine. Don't overdo it right before bed.

items.title: Total Rest (or Light Shakeout)
items.description: Stay off your feet. A 15-20 minute very light jog is okay *only* if it's a firm part of your routine.

items.title: Gear Check
items.description: Lay out your complete race kit: shoes, socks, shorts, shirt, bib (pinned on), and timing chip. Charge your watch.

items.title: Pre-Race Breakfast
items.description: Eat your practiced, high-carb, low-fiber, low-fat meal. Example: Bagel with peanut butter, oatmeal, or a sports bar.

items.title: Top Off Fluids
items.description: Drink about 500ml (16oz) of water or sports drink slowly. Stop drinking 1 hour before the race to allow time for a final bathroom stop.

items.title: Review Your Plan
items.description: Look over your pacing strategy. Visualize crossing the finish line feeling strong. Stay calm and manage nerves.

items.title: Dynamic Warm-up
items.description: About 15-20 minutes before the start, perform 10 minutes of very light jogging to get blood flowing.

items.title: Mobility Drills
items.description: After the jog, do dynamic stretches: leg swings, walking lunges, and high knees. Avoid static stretching (holding stretches).

items.title: Final Fuel (Optional)
items.description: Take one last gel or sip of sports drink 5-10 minutes before the gun if this is part of your practiced strategy.

categories.name: Physique
categories.description: Guidance for aesthetic and bodybuilding competitions.

competitions.name: Bodybuilding Show
competitions.description: A plan to finalize aesthetics, posing, and stage presence for 'Peak Week'.

items.title: Carb-Up / Water Manipulation
items.description: Begin loading carbs (rice cakes, potato) to fill muscles. Follow your coach's specific protocol for water and sodium.

items.title: Apply Base Tan
items.description: Apply the first 1-2 coats of your spray tan. Ensure it's even, dark, and streak-free.

items.title: Rest & Elevate
items.description: Stay off your feet as much as possible. Keep legs elevated to reduce water retention and improve definition.

items.title: Avoid Stress
items.description: Stress can increase cortisol and negatively impact your look. Relax, meditate, and trust the process.

items.title: Breakfast 'Pump' Meal
items.description: Eat a small, specific meal practiced during peak week (e.g., rice cakes, jam, a little protein). Sip water *only* as per your plan.

items.title: Final Tan & Glaze
items.description: Apply the final coat of tan. Do not apply oil/glaze until just before going on stage.

items.title: Pumping Up
items.description: Use light resistance bands for high-rep curls, lateral raises, and push-ups. Do not exhaust the muscle, just create a pump.

items.title: Posing Practice
items.description: Run through your mandatory poses and your routine. Stay warm, confident, and smile.

items.title: Simple Sugars
items.description: Have a small amount of simple sugar (e.g., a few pieces of candy, spoonful of honey) 15-20 minutes before stage time for a final vascular boost.

categories.name: Mind Sports
categories.description: Guidance for competitive events based on intellect and strategy.

competitions.name: Chess Tournament
competitions.description: A plan to ensure mental acuity, focus, and stamina for a long day of matches.

items.title: Light Prep Only
items.description: Review key openings or endgames, but avoid intense, long study sessions. You cannot cram for this.

items.title: Prioritize Sleep
items.description: The most critical factor. Aim for 8+ hours of quality, uninterrupted sleep to ensure peak cognitive function.

items.title: Brain Fuel
items.description: Eat balanced meals with complex carbs and healthy fats (e.g., salmon, nuts, dark leafy greens). Avoid heavy, greasy foods.

items.title: Limit Screen Time
items.description: Avoid excessive video games or social media. Let your brain rest and clear itself.

items.title: Sustained Energy Breakfast
items.description: Eat a breakfast high in protein and complex carbs, but low in sugar. (e.g., Oatmeal with berries or eggs with whole-wheat toast).

items.title: Hydrate for Focus
items.description: Drink water. Dehydration is a major cause of mental fog. Have coffee/tea *only* if it's a normal part of your routine.

items.title: Pack Essentials
items.description: Pack water, healthy snacks (nuts, fruit), any personal chess clock/set, and score sheets.

items.title: Reset Between Rounds
items.description: After a match (win or lose), step away. Get fresh air, walk around. Do not obsess over the last game.

items.title: Snack Smart
items.description: Eat your packed snacks *between* rounds, not during a match. Avoid sugary drinks that lead to a crash.

items.title: Mental Breaks
items.description: During the game, if you feel fatigued, get up, stretch, and walk away from the board for 1-2 minutes to clear your head.
